hypothesis_content.title: BTC Implied Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 7-day realized volatility falls below its 30-day implied volatility by more than 15 percentage points during a NEUTRAL regime, a volatility expansion occurs within 5 trading days, with BTC price moving >3% in either direction.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended volatility compression during neutral periods creates pent-up energy. When implied vol remains elevated while realized vol collapses, options markets are pricing in movement that hasn't materialized yet. This divergence typically resolves with a directional move.
entry_conditions: BTC 7-day realized volatility < BTC 30-day implied volatility - 15%
Volatility compression persists for 3 consecutive days

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC price moves >3.5% from entry price (either direction)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Volatility compression continues for 8 days without breakout

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Volatility compression persists beyond 8 days without significant price movement (>2%), or breakout occurs but fails to sustain beyond 24 hours.
